Forge_Guard.name: Forge Guard
stats: 3% increased armor for each hit you have taken in the last 10 seconds

Paladin.name: Paladin
stats: You deal increased fire, lightning, and physical damage equal to your percent health remaining.
1% increased healing effectiveness per point of attunement

Sentinel-0.name: Juggernaut
reminderText: Each point of strength increases armor by 4%, and improves skills that scale with strength, such as Warpath and Rive.

Sentinel-1.name: Stalwart
description: You have a higher chance to block hits and take less damage from hits that you block.
reminderText: Hits that are blocked deal less damage depending on your block effectiveness and the current area level.

Sentinel-2.name: Armour Clad
description: Adds armour and reduces the damage you take from nearby enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers)

Sentinel-3.name: Aegis of Renewal
description: You have a 25% chance to gain health whenever you block.

Sentinel-4.name: Relentless
reminderText: The base stun immunity lasts for 1 second after the stun has ended.

Sentinel-5.name: Overwhelm
description: Adds physical damage to your melee attacks and increases their chance to stun.

Sentinel-6.name: Gladiator
description: You can dual wield melee weapons by equipping a sword in your off hand. You take more damage while dual wielding (multiplicative with other modifiers).

Sentinel-7.name: Axe Thrower
stats: 8% Chance To Cast Axe Throw On Hit
description: Whenever you hit an enemy you have a chance to throw an {Axe} at the nearest enemy, dealing physical damage to all enemies in its path. This effect has a 1 second cooldown.
reminderText: The {Axe's} damage scales with your strength and dexterity and with increases to physical damage and throwing attack damage.

Sentinel-8.name: Valiant Charge
stats: 6% Increased Cooldown Recovery Speed for Movement Skills
reminderText: Movement skills are any skill that have the movement tag. Adding or removing the movement tag through that skill's tree will change its compatibility with this node.

Sentinel-10.name: Devouring Blade
description: You deal increased damage if you have killed an enemy recently (last 4 seconds).

Sentinel-12.name: World Eater
description: You leech a portion of your melee and void damage as health.

Sentinel-14.name: Patient Doom
description:
Every 3 seconds, your next melee attack deals increased damage.

Excludes movement abilities.

Sentinel-16.name: Dark Maw
stats: 5% Chance To Absorb Health On Kill
description: Whenever you kill an enemy, you have a chance to absorb 5% of its health.

Sentinel-17.name: Renouncement
notScalingStats: 1 Smite Void Spell Damage per Vitality
description: You have additional Vitality and Smite now gains spell void damage per point of Vitality, but no longer gains increased damage per point of Attunement.
reminderText: Each point of vitality grants 10 health and increases health regeneration by 2%.

Sentinel-18.name: Finality
description:
Your melee hits deal increased void damage and instantly kill enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health).

If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node, then the highest threshold is used.

Sentinel-19.name: Future Strike
description: Whenever you hit an enemy you have a chance to inflict a {Future Strike,} an ailment that lasts 2 seconds then deals 60 void damage all at once at the end of its duration. Future Strike counts as damage over time, not as a hit.

Sentinel-20.name: Undending Hunger
description: {Dark Maw} absorbs more health when it triggers.

Sentinel-24.name: Void Aegis
description: You have a chance to be granted {Void Aegis} whenever you are hit, granting you 10% reduced damage taken. Void Aegis breaks after you take 100 damage, releasing a void rift dealing damage to nearby enemies.

Sentinel-25.name: Essence of the End
description:
You have a chance to gain a {Void Essence} on kill.

Void Essences last 7 seconds and grant 15% increased void damage, 15% increased melee damage, and 10% reduced duration of stuns on you.

You can have a maximum of 3 Void Essences at once.

Sentinel-27.name: Steel Aegis
description: You have a higher chance to block hits and take less damage from hits that you block.

Sentinel-28.name: Battle Hardened
description: If you have been hit recently you increased armor.
reminderText: Recently refers to the last 4 seconds.

Sentinel-29.name: Rallying Block
description: You have additional armor for each hit you have blocked recently (last 4 seconds).

Sentinel-34.name: Thornmail
stats: 30 Damage Taken by Attackers when Hit

Sentinel-35.name: Shield Crafter
stats: 10% Chance To Cast Shield On Block
description:
You have a chance to cast a shield from {Ring of Shields} when you block a hit and you have additional block effectiveness per shield from {Ring of Shields}.

This effect can trigger up to 3 times every 6 seconds.

Additionally, your minions have increased health and armor.
reminderText: This does not put Ring of Shields on cooldown if you have it equipped.

Sentinel-36.name: Crushing Blows
description: You have increased mana regen and your melee and throwing attacks deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) based on their mana cost.
reminderText:
For example, if you have 6 points in the node, giving you 3% increased damage per 1 mana cost, a 10 mana cost attack will deal 30% increased damage.

Applies to all damage dealt by the melee attack, not just the melee damage of the initial hit.

Sentinel-37.name: Smelter's Might
stats: Doubled for you with a 2h weapon
description: You and your minions have a chance to inflict bleeding and ignite on hit. This bonus is doubled for you if you are using a two handed melee weapon.

Sentinel-38.name: Infinite Bulwark
stats: 20% Shared Increased Armor On Potion Use
20% Increased Chance To Find Potions On Potion Use
description: You and your minions have increased armor and chance to find potions if you have used a potion recently (last 4 seconds).

Sentinel-39.name: Hammer and Anvil
notScalingStats: 30% Minion Increased Attack Speed On 20 Mana Cost Skill

Sentinel-40.name: Echoing Strikes
description: Your melee attacks, throwing attacks, and void spells have a higher chance to be echoed 1 second later.
reminderText: Movement abilities and {Anomaly} cannot echo.

Sentinel-41.name: Flawless Defender
description: While you are using a shield you have additional armor.

Sentinel-42.name: Iron Reflexes
stats: 2% Reduced Bonus Damage Taken From Crits
description: You have additional Dexterity and you take reduced bonus damage from critical strikes.
reminderText: Each point of Dexterity adds 4 dodge rating and improves skills that rely on the skillfull handling of weapons, such as Lunge and Hammer Throw.

Sentinel-44.name: Crusader
stats: 15% Increased Throwing Attack Critical Strike Chance

Sentinel-47.name: Osprixbane
stats: +3% Shared Elemental Resistance with a Shield
12% Shared Increased Fire Damage over Time with a Shield
notScalingStats: 1% Less Fire Damage Taken Per 10% Overcapped Fire Res
40% Maximum Less Fire Damage Taken From Overcapped Fire Res
description:
While you are using a shield you have additional elemental resistance and deal increased fire damage over time.

These effects also affect your minions.
reminderText: Overcapped refers to the amount of resistance above the normal 75% cap.

Sentinel-48.name: Walls of Solarum
notScalingStats: Doubled Less Damage Taken With 50% Block Chance
description:
You take less damage, and this effect is double if you have at least 50% block chance.

Additionally, you have an additional chance to block hits.

Sentinel-49.name: Fearless
reminderText: Each point of vitality grants 6 health and 1% poison and necrotic resistance.

Sentinel-50.name: Counter Attack
description: When you are hit you have a chance to counter attack enemies with {Retribution,} a melee physical attack that deals damage to nearby enemies. This effect has a 0.2 second cooldown.
reminderText: Retribution is a melee attack. Its damage scales with your strength and your modifiers to melee damage. This effect has a 0.2 second cooldown.

Sentinel-52.name: Shield Breaker
description: Your throwing attacks cost more mana, but shred physical and fire resistance.

Sentinel-53.name: Fresh from the Forge
notScalingStats: +20% Physical Penetration With Forge Strike and Smelter's Wrath
+20% Fire Penetration With Forge Strike and Smelter's Wrath
description: You have additional melee and throwing physical and fire damage.

Sentinel-54.name: Void Well
stats: Consume 3 Void Essences To Refund Mana
description:
While you have 3 or more {Void Essences,} if you drop below 0 mana, you consume 1 void essence to set your mana to 30% of your maximum mana pool.

This effect has a 3 second cooldown.

Sentinel-55.name: Banish
description: {Retribution} deals increased damage and has additional chance to critically strike.
reminderText: Retribution is a melee attack. Its damage scales with your strength and your modifiers to melee damage. This effect has a 0.2 second cooldown.

Sentinel-56.name: Void Corruption
stats: 1% Critical Multiplier Per Point Spent In Void Knight
description: Your critical strikes deal more damage for each passive point you have invested in the Void Knight tree.
reminderText: Your points in Void Knight are displayed on the buttons to the left.

Sentinel-57.name: Rot Ripples
stats: 17# Time Rot Spread On Kill Chance
description: {Time Rot} you inflict lasts longer and whenever you kill an enemy afflicted with Time Rot, nearby enemies have a chance to be inflicted with Time Rot.

Sentinel-58.name: Temporal Corruption
description:
Your spells and attacks deal additional void damage and Smite's base damage is converted to void.

Ignite chance from all sources is converted to slow chance for Smite, and effects from Smite's tree that depend on ignite depend on slow instead.

Smite can no longer provide healing.

Sentinel-59.name: Null Velocity
description:
Whenever you use an ability that reduces your mana below 0, you are granted {Haste} for a duration.

This effect has a 10 second cooldown.

Sentinel-60.name: Rot Grip
description: Your melee attacks have a chance to inflict enemies with {Time Rot.}

Sentinel-63.name: Woe
stats: 5% Increased Void Damage On Melee Kill
description: You deal increased melee damage, and you have increased armor and void damage if you have killed an enemy with a melee attack recently (last 4 seconds).
reminderText: Recently refers to the past 4 seconds.

Sentinel-64.name: Void Flux
stats: Time Shift Nearby Enemies At 20% Health
description:
Whenever damage reduces your health below 20%, you send all nearby enemies forward in time for 4 seconds.

This effect has a 30 second cooldown.

Bosses are only sent forward by a millisecond and do not visually disappear.

Sentinel-65.name: Weapons Master
notScalingStats: 10% Increased Melee Attack Speed With Sword

Sentinel-66.name: Iron Attunement
notScalingStats: 1% Damage Over Time Mitigation From Armor Per 2 Attunement
reminderText: Each point of attunement grants 2 mana and improves skills that rely on the innate magic inside you and your surroundings, such as Manifest Armour and Ring of Shields.

Sentinel-67.name: Liquid Iron
stats: Doubled if you have used a potion recently
description: You take less damage over time (multiplicative with other modifiers) and have additional physical resistance. These bonuses are doubled if you have used a potion recently.

Sentinel-68.name: Master of Arms
stats: 3% Increased Attack Speed While Dual Wilding
3% Reduced Bonus Damage Taken From Crits With Shield
description: You gain a bonus depending on the type of weapon you are wielding.

Sentinel-69.name: Valor
reminderText: Increased healing effectiveness increases the health restored by healing skills only.

Sentinel-70.name: Dedication
reminderText: Each point of attunement grants 2 mana and improves skills that rely on the innate magic inside you and your surroundings, such as Smite and Judgement.

Sentinel-71.name: Defiance
reminderText: Each point of attunement grants 2 mana and improves skills that rely on the innate magic inside you and your surroundings, such as Smite and Judgement.

Sentinel-72.name: Honour
description: You are less likely to be stunned, you have a higher chance to block hits and you take less damage from hits that you block.

Sentinel-73.name: Rahyeh's Strength
stats: 4% Increased Fire Damage On Recent Melee Hit
description: You have additional strength, and you deal increased fire damage if you have hit an enemy with a melee attack recently (last 4 seconds).
reminderText: Each point of strength increases armor by 4%, and improves skills that scale with strength, such as Warpath and Rive.

Sentinel-74.name: Divine Bolt
stats: 20% Chance To Cast Divine Bolt On Melee Hit
description: Whenever you hit an enemy with a melee attack you have a 20% chance to cast {Divine Bolt,} a blast of holy energy that deals fire damage to a random nearby enemy.

Sentinel-75.name: Prayer
description: You have increased damage and healing effectiveness if you have healed yourself or an ally recently (last 4 seconds).
reminderText: Increased healing effectiveness only increases the health restored by healing skills.

Sentinel-76.name: Holy Symbol
description:
When you block you cast {Holy Symbol,} healing yourself.

This effect has a 3 second cooldown.
reminderText: {Holy Symbol} scales with increased healing effectiveness and gains 4% increased healing effectiveness per point of attunement.

Sentinel-77.name: Conviction
reminderText: Penetration can bring enemies below 0% resistance, causing them to take more damage. It applies to all damage, including damage over time.

Sentinel-78.name: Holy Nova
description: {Holy Symbol} also heals allies in an area around you.

Sentinel-79.name: Time Legion
description:
You have increased melee attack speed and your melee attacks have a chance to inflict enemies with {Time Rot.}

Your melee attacks, throwing attacks, and void spells have a higher chance to be echoed 1 second later.
reminderText: Movement abilities and {Anomaly} cannot echo.

Sentinel-80.name: Shared Divinity
stats: 10% Reduced Chance To Cast Divine Bolt On Melee Hit
description: {Divine Bolt} fires extra projectiles, but has a reduced chance to cast on hit.
reminderText: At 5 points invested in this node, Divine Bolt will have a 10% chance to cast on melee hit.

Sentinel-81.name: Penance
description: Your melee and throwing attacks have a chance to cause enemies to bleed, but you have a chance to bleed when an enemy hits you with a melee attack.

Sentinel-82.name: Piety
description: {Divine Bolt} can also target nearby allies, healing them for the amount of base fire damage it would deal.

Sentinel-83.name: Holy Icon
reminderText: Increased healing effectiveness increases the health restored by healing skills only.

Sentinel-84.name: Phoenix Strike
description: Your melee attacks have a chance to ignite on hit

Sentinel-86.name: Holy Precision
description: You have an increased chance to critically strike with spells and throwing attacks. You also have additional critical strike multiplier with lightning skills.

Sentinel-87.name: Redemption
description: Bleed you inflict penetrates physical resistance, and you have a chance to be granted increased damage if you have received a stack of bleeding from {Penance} recently (last 4 seconds).

Sentinel-88.name: Righteous Firebrand
stats: +2 Melee Fire Damage On Recent Spell Cast
description: You deal additional fire damage with melee attacks if you have cast a spell recently (last 4 seconds).

Sentinel-89.name: Shield Wall
description: You have a higher chance to block and you regain heath on block, but you cannot dodge.

Sentinel-91.name: Prayer Aegis
stats: Haste On Heal When Below Endurance Threshold
description: You have additional health and endurance threshold and gain haste for 2 second on heal while you are below your endurance threshold. This effect has a 5 second cooldown.
reminderText: Endurance reduces the damage you take below your endurance threshold. You have a base Endurance Threshold of 20% of your maximum health. Endurance is capped at 60%.

Sentinel-92.name: Sword of Rahyeh
stats: +15% Melee Ignite Chance On Recent Spell Cast
description: Your melee attacks have an additional chance to ignite enemies if you have directly casted a spell recently (last 4 seconds).

Sentinel-94.name: Blinding Light
description: Your hits have a chance to blind enemies and you have higher endurance.
reminderText: Endurance reduces the damage you take below your endurance threshold. You have a base Endurance Threshold of 20% of your maximum health. Endurance is capped at 60%.

Sentinel-95.name: Divine Intervention
description: While you have 3 or more {Divine Essences,} if you would die, you have a 10% chance to instead consume all Divine Essences and be returned to life at full health.

Sentinel-96.name: Divine Essence
description:
You have a chance to be granted a {Divine Essence} when you heal yourself or an ally.

Divine Essences last 10 seconds and grant 10% increased armor and healing effectiveness. They also reduce the duration of stuns on you by 10%.

You can have a maximum of 3 Divine Essences at once.
reminderText: Heal over time effects cannot grant a Divine Essence.

Sentinel-97.name: Alignment
description: Every 3 seconds, the next spell you cast has increased healing effectiveness.

Sentinel-100.name: Folded Steel
description:
Your {Manifest Armor} and {Forged Weapons} deal additional physical damage with their melee attacks.

Additionally, your {Forged Weapons} last longer.
reminderText: Forged Weapons are melee minions summoned on hit by Forge Strike

Sentinel-102.name: Avatar of Regret
description: Your melee attacks, throwing attacks, and void spells have a much higher chance to echo, but you have reduced melee attack speed and throwing attack speed and your skills cost more mana.
reminderText: Movement abilities and {Anomaly} cannot echo.

Sentinel-106.name: Time and Faith
description: You regain mana and a portion of your missing health when you directly use {Rive}, {Vengeance}, {Smite}, or {Multistrike}.

Sentinel-107.name: Mail Crusher
description: You deal increased damage while you have a mace or sceptre equipped.

Sentinel-108.name: Blademaster
description: You have increased attack and cast speed while you have a sword or axe equipped.
reminderText: If you are dual wielding and have both an axe and sword equipped you still only receive the regular benefit from this node, not double.

Sentinel-110.name: Siege Captain
stats: +2 Physical Throwing Attack Damage with a Shield
description: While you have a shield equipped your blocks are more effective and you deal additional physical damage with throwing attacks.

Sentinel-111.name: Champion of the Forge
description: You have increased critical strike chance while wielding a 2 handed weapon.

Sentinel-112.name: Avatar of War
notScalingStats: 10% Increased Area Per Stalwart Stack Consumed
description: You and your minions gain increased fire and physical damage.
reminderText: Stalwart is the mastery passive buff that is gained when you are hit. It grants 5% increased armor for 10 seconds, stacking up to 10 times.

Sentinel-114.name: Heavenfire
description: You have additional spell damage while you have a shield equipped.

VoidKnight.name: Void Knight
stats: Your melee attacks, throwing attacks and void spells have a 10% chance to be repeated by an echo 0.5s later (excludes movement abilities and Anomaly).

ab0lh-2.name: Vorpal Reverberation
description: Abyssal Decay deals additional spell void damage.
reminderText: This applies to the initial hit if you have the {Potent Corruption} node.

ab0lh-3.name: Rippling Corrosion
description: Abyssal Echoes' initial burst shreds enemy armor.

ab0lh-4.name: Tides of Rust
description: Armor shred applied by Abyssal Decay has increased effect.

ab0lh-5.name: Time Compression
description: Abyssal Echoes no longer has a cooldown, but costs more mana.

ab0lh-6.name: Abyssal Dispersion
description: Abyssal Echoes costs less mana.

ab0lh-7.name: Nether Breach
description: Directly using Abyssal Echoes has a chance to cast a {Void Rift} from each nearby {Devouring Orb}.

ab0lh-8.name: Dark Torrent
description: Abyssal Echoes can now be cast at the target location.

ab0lh-9.name: Turbulence
description: Abyssal Decay has increased duration.

ab0lh-10.name: Myopia
description: Abyssal Decay now blinds enemies.

ab0lh-11.name: Fragility
description: Abyssal Decay causes enemies to have reduced physical resistance, but it is no longer consumed when the enemy is hit.

ab0lh-12.name: Crumbling
description: Abyssal Decay causes enemies to take increased damage over time.

ab0lh-13.name: Impair the Weak
stats: DoT -> Damage To Enemy On Hit
description: Abyssal Decay now deals damage when the enemy is hit, rather than over time. Each hit deals a portion of the full damage Abyssal Decay would have dealt over its full duration. This damage still counts as damage over time.

ab0lh-14.name: Embrace the Darkness
description: Directly using Abyssal Echoes grants you {Nether Coating} for 5 seconds, granting you increased attack speed with your melee and throwing attacks and causing you to deal more damage to blinded enemies.

ab0lh-15.name: Abyssal Tendrils
description: {Nether Coating} also grants you a chance to inflict {Time Rot} on hit.

ab0lh-16.name: Sanguine Eruption
description: Abyssal Echoes' initial burst consumes all stacks of bleed on the enemy, causing their damage to be dealt instantly.

ab0lh-17.name: Crippling Waves
description: Abyssal Echoes' initial burst slows enemies.

ab0lh-18.name: Freedom of Movement
description: Abyssal Decay causes Enemies that would apply {Slow} to instead instead grant their target {Haste} for 1 second.

ab0lh-19.name: Void Supremacy
description: After casting Abyssal Echoes your next {Erasing Strike} and {Void Cleave} deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to slowed enemies.

ab0lh-20.name: Deep Expanse
description: Abyssal Echoes affects a larger area.

ab0lh-21.name: Fiery Chasm
description: Abyssal Echoes' initial burst has a chance to ignite enemies.

ab0lh-22.name: Potent Corruption
description: Abyssal Echoes' initial burst now hits and deals spell void damage, but no longer inflicts Abyssal Decay.

ab0lh-23.name: Void Purifier
description:
Spell void damage from {Potent Corruption}, {Vorpal Reverberation} and attribute scaling is converted to fire. Consequently this damage scales with increases to fire damage, but not increases to void damage.

Abyssal Echoes' initial burst now also heals you and your allies and nodes on this tree that grant more damage also grant more healing.

ab0lh-24.name: Heavenly Gift
description: Abyssal Echoes' damage now scales with attunement rather than vitality, and its healing effectiveness is also increased by attunement.

ab0lh-25.name: Vorpal Explosion
description: Abyssal Echoes deals significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but no longer chains.

ab0lh-26.name: Spreading Chaos
description: Abyssal Decay now spreads to several nearby enemies after 1 second.

ab0lh-27.name: Overwhelming Doom
description: Abyssal Decay spreads to enemies further away and can spread to more enemies when it spreads.

ab0lh-28.name: Shrieking Echoes
description: {Abyssal Rifts} cast additional Abyssal Echoes.

ab0lh-29.name: Screaming Rifts
description: Abyssal Echoes now creates an {Abyssal Rift} at the target location that casts Abyssal Echoes for you 3 times at its location before expiring.

ab0lh-31.name: Corrupting Harness
description:
Abyssal Echoes can chain additional times. 

This effect is tripled for echoed casts.

ab0lh-32.name: Resounding Abyss
description: Echoed casts deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ah443-2.name: Flame Burst
description:
Your melee hits apply 10 stacks of {Fiery Inquisition} and the melee hits of other allies affected by the aura apply 1 stack. If an enemy reaches 60 stacks, the stacks are consumed to release a {Flame Burst}, dealing fire damage to surrounding enemies.

While Holy Aura is active twice as many stacks are applied.

The {Flame Burst} scales with the stats of the player or minion that triggers it.
reminderText: Modifiers to chance to apply ailments also modify the number of stacks applied. For example your {Warpath} hits apply 6 stacks, and allies' warpath hits have a 60% chance to apply 1 stack.

ah443-3.name: Improved Flame Burst
description: If you are the one to get the final hit to unleash {Flame Burst} on an enemy, it deals significantly more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: {Flame Burst} deals fire damage to surrounding enemies, and is unleashed after successive melee attacks on the same enemy.

ah443-4.name: Fanaticism
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies increased attack and cast speed.

ah443-5.name: True Strike
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies increased critical strike chance.

ah443-6.name: Extreme Zeal
description: Holy Aura causes you and your allies' critical strikes to deal more damage.

ah443-7.name: Burning Blows
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies increased fire damage.

ah443-8.name: Rahyeh's Devotion
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies a chance to ignite enemies.

ah443-9.name: Rahyeh's Fury
description: Holy Aura causes you and your allies to penetrate enemy fire resistance.

ah443-10.name: Call To Arms
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies increased physical damage.

ah443-11.name: Strength From Afar
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies increased throwing attack damage and increased stun chance with throwing attacks.

ah443-12.name: Shelter from the Storm
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies additional elemental resistance and endurance threshold.

ah443-13.name: Swiftness
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies additional dodge chance.

ah443-14.name: Redemption
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies increased healing effectiveness.

ah443-15.name: Concentration
description: Holy Aura's active duration lasts longer, but Holy Aura's cooldown lasts longer and its passive is disabled during its cooldown.

ah443-16.name: Purification
description:
Holy Aura grants you and your allies additional poison resistance.
Activating Holy Aura cleanses ailments for you and your allies.

ah443-17.name: Demoralizing Aura
description: Activating Holy Aura grants you a chance to slow surrounding enemies each second.

ah443-18.name: Expedite
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies increasing throwing attack speed and a chance to gain {Haste} for 1 second on hit.

ah443-19.name: Vital Boon
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies increased health regeneration.

ah443-20.name: Faith
description: Holy Aura regenerates ward for you and nearby allies.

ah443-21.name: Shielded By Faith
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies increased ward retention.

ah443-22.name: Faith's Reward
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies a burst of ward when activated, but Holy Aura has a longer cooldown.

ah443-23.name: Mighty Shield
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies additional block effectiveness and health when blocking attacks.

ah443-24.name: Against The Odds
description: Holy Aura grants you and your allies ward when blocking attacks.

ah443-26.name: Hope
description: When an enemy dies in Holy Aura's area of effect, there is a chance it spawns a {Health Globe}, healing for 70 health.
reminderText: {Health Globes} scale with increased healing effectiveness.

ah443-28.name: Inner Flame
description: Your melee hits apply an additional stack of {Fiery Inquisition} and if you are the one to get the final hit to unleash {Flame Burst} on an enemy, it deals damage in an increased area.
reminderText: {Flame Burst} deals fire damage to surrounding enemies, and is unleashed after successive melee attacks on the same enemy.

an0my-1.name: Emission
description: Anomaly hits enemies in a larger area.

an0my-2.name: Red Shift
description: Anomaly lasts longer.

an0my-3.name: Borrowed Time
description: Anomaly is cast instantly, but Anomaly has a longer cooldown.

an0my-4.name: Time Wave
stats: Time Wave Cast On Enemy Return
description: When enemies return to the present a {Time Wave} is released, a spell dealing void damage to nearby enemies.

an0my-5.name: Temporal Expanse
description: {Time Wave} deals more hit damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) in a larger area, and increases to Anomaly's area also affect Time Wave.

an0my-6.name: Tides of Time
description: An additional {Time Wave} is released when you cast Anomaly.

an0my-7.name: Anticipation
description: Anomaly has a shorter cooldown.

an0my-8.name: Reflection
description: {Future Strike} is applied to all enemies hit by Anomaly.

an0my-9.name: Resonate
description: {Future Strikes} applied by Anomaly have additional Void Penetration

an0my-10.name: Quicksand
description: When enemies return to the present, all damaging ailments currently applied to them apply faster.
reminderText: This affects the duration of ailments, not damage.

an0my-11.name: Cycle of Decay
description: When enemies return to the present, the duration of damaging ailments applied to them is reset.

an0my-12.name: Void Touched
description: Enemies hit by Anomaly are afflicted with {Time Rot} when they return.

an0my-13.name: Exacerbate
description: {Time Rot} inflicted by Anomaly lasts longer and has additional Void Penetration

an0my-14.name: Mark of Rot
description: When enemies return to the present, they take increased void damage for a duration.

an0my-15.name: Voidfire
description: Anomaly now applies Ignite instead of Time Rot. Modifiers to Time Rot apply to Ignite instead.

an0my-16.name: Hour of Flame
description: Anomaly applies additional stacks of ignite.

an0my-17.name: Time Bubble
stats: 2 Void Res Shred Stacks per Second
description: Anomaly leaves behind a {Time Bubble} for 5 seconds, which slows enemies and shreds their void resistance.

an0my-18.name: Decimation
description: {Time Bubble} grants you and your allies increased critical strike chance while in its area.

an0my-19.name: Temporal Mastery
description: {Time Bubble} lasts longer.

an0my-20.name: Time Lord
stats: Time Bubble Is Cast On You
description: {Time Bubble} is now cast on yourself and moves with you, but Anomaly costs more mana.

an0my-22.name: Manipulation
description: {Time Bubble} grants you and your allies increased attack and cast speed while in its area.

an0my-23.name: Swiftrest
description: {Time Bubble} grants you and your allies increased cooldown recovery speed while in its area.

an0my-24.name: Time Eater
description: {Time Bubble} grants you and your allies global health leech. This is doubled for void damage.

an0my-25.name: Void Maw
description: {Time Bubble} grants you and your allies increased health leech while in its area.

an0my-26.name: Immediacy
stats: No Longer Sends Enemies Forward In Time
description: Anomaly no longer sends enemies foward in time. Effects that would be triggered when enemies return to the present are instead triggered immediately.

an0my-27.name: Time Lock
description:
When enemies return to the present they are afflicted by {Time Lock,} rendering them unable to move, attack, or cast spells for 2 seconds.

Anomaly costs more mana.

10% of remaining cooldown recovered whenever you {Time Lock} an enemy with Anomaly. This effect can occur a maximum of two times each second.
reminderText: Does not affect bosses.

an0my-28.name: Temporal Prison
description: {Time Lock} lasts longer.

an0my-29.name: Stasis
stats: Nearby Enemies Afflicted With Time Lock On Return
description: When enemies return to the present, enemies within the area of Anomaly's original cast are also time locked for 2 seconds.

an0my-30.name: Lingering Memory
stats: Time Bubble Effects Persist For 2 Seconds On Exit
description: When allies or enemies exit {Time Bubble's} area of effect, effects caused or granted by Time Bubble persist for 2 seconds.

do5vr-2.name: Dark Moon
description: Devouring Orb now orbits you, but has a much shorter duration (multiplicative with other duration modifiers).

do5vr-3.name: Distant Satellite
description: Devouring Orb deals more damage and orbits you at a greater distance.

do5vr-4.name: Abyssal Rush
description: You have increased attack speed, cast speed, and movement speed while a Devouring Orb is active.

do5vr-5.name: Cosmic Impact
description: Devouring Orb now deals void damage to enemies it collides with.
reminderText: Added spell damage applies to the collision at 200% effectiveness.

do5vr-6.name: Extinction
description:
Devouring Orb deals more hit damage to enemies it collides with (multiplicative with other modifiers).

This ONLY affects the damage that devouring orb deals when the orb itself collides with an enemy, not the damage dealt by its void rifts or other sub skills.

do5vr-7.name: Void Adept
description:
You deal more global void damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and have increased mana regen while a Devouring Orb is active.

These bonuses are doubled if you have at least 90 vitality.

do5vr-8.name: Hollow Orb
stats: Successive Void Rifts Do Not Gain Damage
Successive Void Rifts Do Not Gain Area
description: Devouring Orb lasts longer, but a Devouring Orb's {Void Rifts} no longer increase in size or damage for each successive rift.
reminderText: This effect is multiplicative with other duration modifiers.

do5vr-9.name: Abyssal Emission
description: Every 3 seconds Devouring Orb releases an {Abyssal Orb}, a spell which seeks enemies and detonates, dealing void damage in an area.
reminderText: The area of the rifts created by Abyssal Orbs scale with void rift area modifiers from this tree and with Increased Area for Area Skills stats.

do5vr-10.name: Chaotic Torrent
description: The rate at which Devouring Orbs cast {Abyssal Orb} is increased by a random amount.

do5vr-11.name: Cataclysm
description:
Devouring Orb now erupts at the end of its duration, creating a {Void Eruption}.

Devouring Orb has a much shorter duration (multiplicative with other duration modifiers).
reminderText:
An enemy cannot be hit by more than once by a single Void Eruption.

The area of the rifts created by the Void Eruption scale with void rift area modifiers from this tree and with Increased Area for Area Skills stats.

do5vr-12.name: Fleeting Orb
description: Devouring Orb costs less mana, but has a shorter duration (multiplicative with other duration modifiers).

do5vr-13.name: Dust Channeller
description: Devouring Orb has increased cast speed and a shorter cooldown.

do5vr-14.name: Orb Master
description: Devouring Orb has a shorter cooldown and {Void Eruption} deals more damage

do5vr-15.name: Rift Caller
description: All damage from Devouring Orb penetrates enemy void resistance. This includes {Void Rifts} and other sub skills and sources of damage added by this tree, and any ailments they inflict

do5vr-16.name: Soul Eater
description: The rate at which {Void Rift} hit damage increments when a nearby enemy dies is increased.
reminderText: This is multiplicative with the default increase, not additive.

do5vr-17.name: Soul Gorger
description: The rate at which {Void Rifts'} area grows when a nearby enemy dies is increased.
reminderText: This is multiplicative with the default increase, not additive.

do5vr-18.name: Abyssal Expanse
description: {Void Rifts} hit enemies in a larger area.

do5vr-19.name: Devour the Weak
stats: +15% Void Rift HIt Damage Vs Stunned
description: {Void Rift} hits deal more damage against stunned enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

do5vr-20.name: World Rot
description: Devouring Orb lasts longer and {Void Rifts} have a chance to inflict {Time Rot}.
reminderText: This Devouring Orb duration increase is multiplicative with other duration modifiers.

do5vr-21.name: Rotting Prey
stats: +15% Void Rift Hit Damage Vs Time Rotted Enemies
description: {Void Rift} hits deal more damage against time rotted enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

do5vr-22.name: Voidfire Rift
description: {Void Rift} hits have a chance to ignite enemies.

do5vr-23.name: Burning Prey
stats: +20% Void Rift Hit Damage Vs Ignited Enemies
description: {Void Rift} hits against ignited enemies deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

do5vr-24.name: Sightless Star
description: Devouring Orb has increased cast speed and costs less mana.

do5vr-25.name: Patient Hunger
description: Devouring orb gains additional charges.

do5vr-26.name: Abyssal Juggernaut
description: You have additional void resistance while you have an active Devouring Orb.

es6ai-2.name: Dust To Wind
description: Erasing Strike and {Void Rifts} it creates deals damage in a larger area.

es6ai-3.name: Rifts of Decay
description: Erasing Strike hits have a chance to inflict enemies with {Time Rot}, an ailment that deals void damage over time, increases stun duration by 5%, lasts 3 seconds, and stacks up to 12 times.

es6ai-4.name: Regicide
description: When Erasing Strike hits a boss or rare enemy you have a chance to cast {Void Beam} at their location, a spell that continuously damages surrounding enemies for 3 seconds.
reminderText: {Void Beam} scales with increased void and spell damage.

es6ai-5.name: Rifts of Destruction
description: {Void Rifts} deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: {Void Rift} is a spell which deals void damage in an area.

es6ai-6.name: Iriesha's Fall
stats: +50% Rift Hit Damage Vs Stunned Enemies
description: {Erasing Strike} has increased stun chance and {Void Rift} hits deal more damage against stunned enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

es6ai-7.name: Mark of the End
description: Erasing Strike hits shred enemy void resistance.

es6ai-8.name: Void Pyre
description: When Erasing Strike kills an enemy you have a chance to cast {Void Beam} at their location, a spell that continuously damages surrounding enemies for 3 seconds.
reminderText: {Void Beam} scales with increased void and spell damage.

es6ai-9.name: Merciful
description: Erasing Strike has increased cooldown recovery speed and deals more melee damage to enemies that are already damaged (multiplicative with other modifiers).

es6ai-10.name: Ruthless
stats: +25% Melee Damage Vs Full Health Enemies
description: Erasing Strike deals more melee damage to enemies at full health (multiplicative with other modifiers).

es6ai-11.name: Erasure of the Living
description: Erasing Strike deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and instantly kill enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health).
reminderText: If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

es6ai-12.name: Void Lens
description: All {Void Beams} created by Erasing Strike deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: {Void Beam} scales with increased void and spell damage.

es6ai-13.name: Time Loop
description: Erasing Strike consumes mana to cause additional echoes when used. Each echo will appear one second after the last. These additional echos cannot be created while you have negative mana.

es6ai-14.name: Shattered Continuity
description: Erasing Strike no longer has a cooldown.

es6ai-15.name: Chamber of Fate
description: Erasing Strike hits have a chance to slow and deals more melee damage to slowed enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

es6ai-16.name: Obliteration
description: Erasing Strike and the spells it triggers deal additional void damage. This bonus is doubled while wielding two handed weapon.

es6ai-17.name: Prophet's Onslaught
description: Improves Erasing Strike's base critical strike chance.

es6ai-18.name: Essence of the End
description:
Erasing Strike critical strikes have a chance to grant you a {Void Essence}, which grant 15% increased void damage, 15% increased melee damage, and 10% reduced stun duration. 

You can have a maximum of 3 void essences at once.

es6ai-19.name: Certain Erasure
description: Erasing Strike critical strikes deal more damage.

es6ai-20.name: Absorb the Remains
stats: 1% Health Gained On Rare or Boss Hit
description: When Erasing Strike kills an enemy or hits a boss or rare enemy you regain health equal to a percentage of the target's maximum health.

es6ai-21.name: Moments Stolen
description: You gain the {Haste} buff for 1 second, granting 30% increased movement speed when Erasing Strike kills an enemy or hits a boss or rare enemy.
reminderText: {Haste} does not stack.

es6ai-22.name: Ravenous Void
description: If you kill 5 or more enemies simultaneously with Erasing Strike, you create 4 {Void Beams} which travel at random, damaging surrounding enemies for 3 seconds.
reminderText: {Void Beams} scale with increased void and spell damage.

es6ai-23.name: Void Bringer
description: The kills required to summon {Void Beams} via the {Ravenous Void} node require less kills to trigger, but Erasing Strike costs more mana.

es6ai-24.name: Implements of Destruction
description:
Erasing Strike deals more void damage if you are using a two handed mace (multiplicative with other modifiers).

Erasing Strike has increased cooldown recovery speed if you are using a two handed sword.

Erasing Strike's melee hit and void rifts have a larger area of effect if you are using a two handed axe.

es6ai-26.name: Final Hour
stats: +100% Melee Damage vs 12 stacks of Time Rot
description:
Bleed chance from all sources is converted to {Time Rot} chance for Erasing Strike and effects related to bleed now depend on Time Rot instead. 

Erasing Strike deals more melee damage against targets with 12 stacks of Time Rot (multiplicative with other modifiers).

es6ai-27.name: Twin Cataclysms
description: You can store an additional charge of Erasing Strike.

es6ai-28.name: Hastened Cataclysm
description: Erasing Strike has increased cooldown recovery speed, but also has a higher mana cost.

fs3e3-1.name: Ironbound
description: Improves Forge Strike's base critical chance, and critical strikes deal more damage.

fs3e3-2.name: Lightforge
description: Forge Strike has increased cooldown recovery speed and attack speed. The attack speed bonus also applies to your Forged Weapons.

fs3e3-3.name: Arcane Welding
description: You are granted ward when Forge Strike summons a {Forged Weapon}.
reminderText: {Forged Weapons} are melee minions who seek out enemies and attack them.

fs3e3-4.name: Rewarding Craft
description: {Forged Weapons} no longer move or attack, but generate ward when you are near them.
reminderText: {Forged Weapons} are melee minions who seek out enemies and attack them.

fs3e3-5.name: Singular Craft
description: Improves Forge Strike's base critical chance and its hits inflict bleeding on hit, but your maximum number of {Forged Weapons} is halved.
reminderText: If you have an odd number of maximum forged weapons the number is rounded up.

fs3e3-6.name: Put to the Sword
stats: Crit Multiplier -> Physical Penetration for Bleed
description:
Converts Forge Strike into a sword that falls from the sky instead. Forge Strike has more attack speed (multiplicative with other modifiers), cannot crit, and critical strike multiplier from the tree is converted to additional Physical Penetration for Bleed.

Converts to a polearm if you also have the {Spear Forge} node.

fs3e3-7.name: Spear Forge
description:
Converts Forge Strike into a spear that falls from the sky instead. Forge Strike critical strikes deal significantly more damage, but it hits in a smaller area.

Converts to a polearm if you also have the {Put To The Sword} node.

fs3e3-8.name: Heavy Strike
description: Forge Strike and {Forged Weapons} deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and have an increased chance to stun enemies.
reminderText: The bonuses from this node apply to Forged Weapons from all sources, not just from Forge Strike.

fs3e3-9.name: Rending Descent
description: Forge Strike hits reduce enemy armor, and armor shred applied by it last longer with increased effect.

fs3e3-10.name: Eagle Strike
description: Forge Strike can now be cast at your target instead of in front of you.

fs3e3-11.name: Reinforce Weapon
description: You deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) if you have used Forge Strike recently (last 4 seconds).

fs3e3-12.name: Reinforce Armor
description: You have increased armor if you have used Forge Strike recently (last 4 seconds).

fs3e3-14.name: Goliath Strike
stats: 25% More Hit Damage Against Rares And Bosses
description: Forge Strike hits deal more damage against rare and boss enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers).

fs3e3-15.name: Engines of War
description: Forge Strike and {Forged Weapons'} hits deal damage in a larger area

fs3e3-16.name: Anvil Blow
description:
Converts Forge Strike into an anvil that falls from the sky instead. Forge Strike has an increased chance to stun enemies, and stuns it inflicts lasts longer, but it has less attack speed (multiplicative with other modifiers).

Additionally, when you directly use Forge Strike it deals more physical damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: The visual effect of this node will not apply if you have any other visual alterations in this tree. You will still gain the increased stun chance.

fs3e3-17.name: Temper
description: Forge Strike deals additional melee fire damage and more fire damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

fs3e3-18.name: Detonating Ground
description: Forge Strike causes {Detonating Ground}, sending out cracks which erupt after 1.5 seconds, dealing melee fire damage and igniting enemies.

fs3e3-19.name: Lava Burn
description: {Detonating Ground} hits deal more damage.

fs3e3-20.name: Ignited Grounds
description: {Detonating Ground} has a chance to ignite enemies on hit.

fs3e3-21.name: Forged by Fire
description:
{Forged Weapons} deal additional melee fire damage.

{Forged Weapons} gain the {fire} tag.
reminderText: The bonuses from this node apply to Forged Weapons from all sources, not just from Forge Strike.

fs3e3-22.name: Well Forged Weapons
description: {Forged Weapons} last longer and you can control more forged weapons at once.
reminderText: The bonuses from this node apply to Forged Weapons from all sources, not just from Forge Strike.

fs3e3-23.name: Forgemaster
stats: 30% Chance To Convert To Great Axe
description: {Forged Weapons} now have a chance to become a {Great Axe} on summon, which deal more damage in a larger area, but attack slower.
reminderText: The bonuses from this node apply to Forged Weapons from all sources, not just from Forge Strike.

fs3e3-24.name: Mass Production
description: Forge Strike has a higher chance to summon {Forged Weapons}. This added chance is much higher against bosses and rare enemies.
reminderText: With 3 points invested in this node Forge Strike always summons a Forged Weapon on hit against bosses and rare enemies.

fs3e3-25.name: Shrapnel
description: {Forged Weapons} have a much shorter duration, but deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), and explode when they expire, dealing fire and physical damage to nearby enemies.
reminderText: {Forged Weapons} are melee minions who seek out enemies and attack them.

fs3e3-26.name: Serrated Blade
description: Bleed inflicted by Forge Strike has additional Physical Penetration and lasts longer.

fs3e3-28.name: Beneath Solarum
description: Forge Strike has no cooldown, but costs additional mana.

fs3e3-29.name: Bellows
description: Ailments inflicted by Forge Strike deal increased damage over time equal to your increased stun chance.
reminderText: Includes increased stun chance from this tree

fs3e3-30.name: Fan The Flames
description: You have additional global Fire Penetration if you have used Forge Strike recently (last 4 seconds).

gs15de-2.name: Double Riposte
description: You can {Riposte} an additional time after Vengeance hits an enemy, but Riposte mitigates less damage.

gs15de-3.name: Dark Duellist
description: You deal more global damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) while preparing to riposte.

gs15de-4.name: Zealot's Technique
description: You can {Riposte} an additional time after Vengeance hits an enemy.

gs15de-5.name: Rapid Strikes
description: Vengeance has increased attack speed.

gs15de-6.name: Vengeful Fighter
description: Vengeance deals more damage if you are below half health (multiplicative with other modifiers).

gs15de-7.name: Blade Assault
description: When you hit an enemy with Vengeance you have a chance to attack with {Iron Blade}.
reminderText: {Iron Blade} is a melee attack that releases a sword that pierces through enemies, dealing physical damage. Its damage does not scale with nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

gs15de-8.name: Combo Riposte
description: When you hit an enemy with {Riposte} you have a chance to also attack with {Iron Blade}.
reminderText: {Iron Blade} is a melee attack that releases a sword that pierces through enemies, dealing physical damage. Its damage does not scale with nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

gs15de-9.name: Vital Puncture
description: {Iron Blade} has a chance to deal double damage.
reminderText: {Iron Blade} is a melee attack that releases a sword that pierces through enemies, dealing physical damage. Its damage does not scale with nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

gs15de-10.name: Shattering Blade
description: {Iron Blade} has a chance to reduce enemy armor.
reminderText: {Iron Blade} is a melee attack that releases a sword that pierces through enemies, dealing physical damage. Its damage does not scale with nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

gs15de-11.name: Winged Steel
description: {Iron Blade} travels faster, causing it to also travel further.
reminderText: {Iron Blade} is a melee attack that releases a sword that pierces through enemies, dealing physical damage. Its damage does not scale with nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

gs15de-12.name: Deflection
description: {Iron Blade} ricochets to another enemy on hit, but Iron Blade deals less hit damage and no longer pierces (travels through enemies it hits).
reminderText: {Iron Blade} is a melee attack that releases a sword that pierces through enemies, dealing physical damage. Its damage does not scale with nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

gs15de-13.name: Forge Chains
description: {Iron Blade} ricochets to additional enemies, but travels more slowly.
reminderText: {Iron Blade} is a melee attack that releases a sword that pierces through enemies, dealing physical damage. Its damage does not scale with nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

gs15de-14.name: Vindicator
stats: 25% Iron Blade Chance On Riposte Kill
description: You have a chance to attack with {Iron Blade} when you kill an enemy with {Riposte}.
reminderText: {Iron Blade} is a melee attack that releases a sword that pierces through enemies, dealing physical damage. Its damage does not scale with nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

gs15de-15.name: Vengeful Slayer
stats: 10% Iron Blade Chance On Vengeance Kill
description: You have a chance to attack with {Iron Blade} when you kill an enemy with Vengeance.
reminderText: {Iron Blade} is a melee attack that releases a sword that pierces through enemies, dealing physical damage. Its damage does not scale with nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

gs15de-16.name: Executioner
description: Vengeance hits deal more damage against enemies that are already damaged (multiplicative with other modifiers).

gs15de-17.name: Faint Strike
description: Vengeance deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but has a lower chance to stun enemies.

gs15de-18.name: Punishment
description: You have a chance to also retaliate with {Iron Blade} when you {Riposte}.
reminderText: {Iron Blade} is a melee attack that releases a sword that pierces through enemies, dealing physical damage. Its damage does not scale with nodes on this tree unless stated otherwise.

gs15de-19.name: Bolster
description: You take less damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and have increased armor if you've hit an enemy with Vengeance in the past 2 seconds.

gs15de-20.name: Essence of Revenge
stats: 15% Void Essence Chance On Riposte Hit
description:
{Riposte} has a chance to grant a {Void Essence} on hit. 

Void Essences last 7 seconds and grant 15% increased void damage, 15% increased melee damage, and 10% reduced stun duration.

You can have a maximum of 3 Void Essences at once.

gs15de-21.name: Essence of Vindication
stats: 15% Void Essence Chance On Vengeance Kill
description: Kills with Vengeance have a chance to grant you a {Void Essence}.
reminderText: {Void Essence} grant 15% increased void damage, 15% increased melee damage, and 10% reduced stun duration. You can have a maximum of 3 essences at once.

gs15de-22.name: Smelter's Vengeance
description: Vengeance has a chance to shred enemy armor and fire resistance.

gs15de-23.name: Molten Riposte
stats: Fire Resistance Shred Applies To Riposte
description: The armor and fire resistance shred chance from the {Smelter's Vengeance} node also apply on {Riposte} hits.

gs15de-24.name: Eviscerating Blades
description: Increases the effectiveness of all armor shred applied by Vengeance and {Riposte}.
reminderText:
Does not affect fire resistance shred effectiveness

With a total of 50% increased effect each stack of Armour Shred reduces armour by 150 instead of 100.

gs15de-26.name: Blade Paladin
description: The damage increase from the {Vengeful Fighter} node applies when above half health, instead of when below half health.

gs15de-28.name: Cooling Anvil
description: Fire resistance shred granted by this tree is converted to physical resistance shred.

gs15de-30.name: Perfect Riposte
description: Hits that you {Riposte} cannot critically strike you.
reminderText: Hits that you riposte that would have crit are downgraded to regular hits and do not deal additional damage.

hh7pa3-1.name: Searing Light
description: Healing Hands now hits enemies within its area of effect, dealing spell fire damage. Added spell damage applies to it at 200% effectiveness.

hh7pa3-2.name: Bane of Evil
stats: +1 Spell Damage per 20% increased Healing Effectiveness
description: Healing hands deals additional spell damage based on your Increased Healing Effectiveness and on Increased Healing Effectiveness from this tree.

hh7pa3-3.name: Halted Scourge
description:
Healing Hands {Immobilizes} void enemies for 1 second on hit and deals more damage to them (multiplicative with other modifiers).

Healing Hands grants allies 10% less void damage taken (multiplicative with other modifiers) for 10 seconds when cast on them. This buff does not stack.
reminderText:
You count as an ally so casting Healing Hands on yourself will grant you the buff.

Void Enemies include cultists, husks, pure voidforms, and voidfused enemies. They are encountered frequently in the Ruined Era.

hh7pa3-4.name: Turn Undead
description:
Healing Hands fears Undead Enemies for 2 to 3 seconds on hit and deals more damage to them (multiplicative with other modifiers).

Healing Hands grants allies 10% less necrotic damage taken (multiplicative with other modifiers) for 10 seconds when cast on them. This buff does not stack.
reminderText:
Fear causes enemies to flee from you and your allies. Enemies can only be affected by Fear once.

You count as an ally so casting Healing Hands on yourself will grant you the buff.

Undead enemies include skeletons, wraiths, zombies, and most other enemies encountered in the Imperial Era.

hh7pa3-5.name: Cleric's Wrath
stats: +0.5% Damage per Level of Specialised Buff Skills
description: Healing hands deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) based on the combined levels of your specialised Buff skills.
reminderText: Only Skills with the Buff tag are counted.

hh7pa3-6.name: Consecrated Storm
description: Healing hands has a chance to {Electrify} on hit.

hh7pa3-7.name: Holy Winds
description: Healing Hands deals more lightning damage over time (multiplicative with other modifiers) and when you hit an electrified enemy with Healing Hands it spreads all stacks of your stacks of electrify from that enemy to a number of other enemies within 5 metres.

hh7pa3-8.name: Seraph Blade
description:
Healing Hands is converted into a melee attack that hits in a wide arc in front of you. It now scales with melee damage instead of spell damage and effects on this tree that granted spell damage now grant melee damage instead.

Healing Hands still heals you, as well as allies within its area of affect.

hh7pa3-9.name: Prayer of the Fallen
description: Healing Hands has increased healing effectiveness. This bonus is doubled if there is a dead player within 30 meters.

hh7pa3-10.name: Blessed Parish
description: Healing Hands has an increased area of effect and a lower mana cost.

hh7pa3-11.name: Purity of Thought
description: Healing Hands has a lower mana cost.

hh7pa3-12.name: Divine Catalyst
description:
You cast {Divine Bolt} at nearby enemies when you directly cast healing hands and heal yourself or an ally.

Divine Bolt is affected by specific passives from the Paladin tree and if you take this node then Divine Bolt from all sources scales with nodes on this tree.

hh7pa3-13.name: Divine Barrier
description:
Healing Hands also grants ward to allies based on your Attunement.

If the ally has an effect that causes them to gain ward per second based on their missing health, then it will not heal them, but will provide a percentage of its healing as ward.
reminderText: You count as your own ally and are affected by this node when you cast Healing Hands on yourself.

hh7pa3-14.name: Homeward
stats: Cast at self if not targeting ally
description:
If Healing Hands would not affect any allied players at the chosen target location, it is cast centered on you instead.

Healing Hands has increased healing effectiveness.

hh7pa3-15.name: Synthesis of Light
description: Healing Hands also grants ward to allies based on your Increased Healing Effectiveness and on Increased Healing Effectiveness from this tree.
reminderText: You count as your own ally and are affected by this node when you cast Healing Hands on yourself.

hh7pa3-16.name: Unbroken Prayer
description: Healing Hands becomes a channeled ability, casting 4 times per second regardless of cast speed, and draining your mana.
reminderText:
If you have the {Seraph Blade} node, then the melee attacks occur in random directions while you channel.

If you have the {Rahyeh's Chariot} node then this node has no effect.

hh7pa3-17.name: Guardian's Chant
stats: 10% Upfront Ward gained as Ward per Second
description:
Healing Hands also grants ward per second for three seconds after being cast on an ally.

The ward per second is equal to a proportion of the ward granted up front by the other nodes on this tree and by items that cause you to grant ward with Healing Hands.

This effect cannot stack multiple times, casting again on the same ally just refreshes the duration.
reminderText: You count as your own ally an are affected by this node when you cast Healing Hands on yourself.

hh7pa3-18.name: Urgent Healing
description: Healing Hands restores additional health up front.

hh7pa3-19.name: Vow of Restoration
description: Healing Hands restores additional health over time. This lasts for three seconds just like Healing Hands' inherent healing over time effect.

hh7pa3-20.name: Cleric's Hammer
stats: 25% Healing Hands Chance on Melee Hit
-65% Less Up Front Healing For Indirect Casts
description:
When you directly use a melee attack and hit at least one enemy, you have a chance to cast Healing Hands around the target. This consumes mana based on Healing Hands's mana cost.

Healing Hands restores less up front health when cast indirectly.

hh7pa3-21.name: Hand of Aurelus
stats: 25% Healing Hands Chance on Smite Cast
description: When you directly cast Smite, you have a chance to cast Healing Hands around the target location. This consumes 70% of its mana cost.

hh7pa3-22.name: Rahyeh's Chariot
description:
When you directly use Healing Hands you dash to the target location first. However, Healing Hands now has a cooldown and counts a {Traversal} skill.

This does not affect indirect casts of Healing Hands.
reminderText: Using a Traversal skill puts all other traversal skills on cooldown and traversal skills' cooldowns do not recover while you are using a traversal skill.

hh7pa3-23.name: Cloud Voyager
description: A portion of Healing Hands' remaining cooldown is recovered if you use it to heal an ally other than yourself. This effect can occur once per direct cast of Healing Hands.

hh7pa3-24.name: Sacred Gift
description: When you cast Healing Hands, there is a chance it spawns a {Health Globe} at a random point inside the area of effect. When an ally walks over the globe, it is consumed, healing them for 70 health.

hh7pa3-26.name: Sun Shroud
description: You are immune to damage while moving with Healing Hands.

hh7pa3-28.name: Virtue of Patience
description: Healing Hands takes longer to cast, but deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and has increased healing effectiveness and a larger area of effect.
reminderText: The cast speed modifier is also multiplicative with other modifiers and affects attack speed instead if Healing Hands is converted to a melee attack.

hh7pa3-30.name: Font of Salvation
stats: 80% Health Gained as Ward when Healing to Full
description:
If you heal an allied player other than yourself that was below half prior to healing, Healing Hands restores them to full health and grants them ward equal to 80% of their max health.

This has no effect on you, nor on minions, nor players that have an effect that causes them to gain ward per second based on their missing health.

hh7pa3-32.name: Skyfall
description:
While channelling Healing Hands you also call down a beam from the sky that deals fire damage over time to enemies around the target area and heals allies within its area of effect.

Healing Hands costs additional mana per second while channelling.

ht16aw-2.name: Rapid Throw
description: Hammer Throw has increased attack speed.

ht16aw-3.name: Weighted Hammers
description: Hammer Throw deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers), but hammers travels slower.

ht16aw-4.name: Enra's Technique
description:
Hammer Throw can no longer spiral, chain, or orbit.

If your hammers would spiral, they instead deal significantly more hit damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

If your hammers would chain, they instead deal more critical damage for each time they would chain.

If your hammers would orbit you, they instead have additional base critical strike chance.

Hammer Throw hits deal increased damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ht16aw-5.name: Mana Starved Forging
description: When you are out of mana Hammer Throw is free.

ht16aw-6.name: Shattering Force
description: Hammer Throw hits have a chance to reduce enemy armor.

ht16aw-7.name: Disintegrating Aura
description: Your hammers gain a {Disintegrating Aura}, causing enemies nearby them to take void damage over time, but Hammer Throw costs additional mana and has less attack speed (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText:
{Disintegrating Aura} scales with your increases to void damage, damage over time, and throwing attack damage, but not with other nodes on this tree unless specifically stated otherwise. Its area scales with Increased Area for Area skill stats.

Added damage applies to Disintegrating Aura at 200% effectiveness per second.

ht16aw-8.name: Rapid Disintegration
description: {Disintegrating Aura} deals more damage, and Hammer Throw costs less mana.

ht16aw-9.name: Force of Impact
description: Hammer Throw hits deal more damage, have a higher chance to stun enemies, and stun for a longer duration.

ht16aw-10.name: Collision
description: Hammer Throw hits have a higher chance to stun enemies, and the stuns they inflict last longer, but Hammer Throw hits no longer pierce (travel through enemies hit).

ht16aw-11.name: Ricochet
description: Hammers chain to nearby enemies instead of returning to you, but Hammer Throw hits deal less damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and have reduced chance to stun enemies.

ht16aw-12.name: Chaining Hammers
description: Hammers chain to additional enemies, but Hammer Throw has less attack speed and its hits deal less damage (both multiplicative with other modifiers).

ht16aw-13.name: Overwhelm
description: Hammer Throw deals more hit damage against stunned enemies (multiplicative with other modifiers) and the stuns they inflict last longer

ht16aw-14.name: Battle Rouse
description: Hammer Throw has a chance to grant you health on hit.

ht16aw-15.name: Hammer of Want
description: Hammer Throw rips a {Dark Orb} from enemies on hit, which travels back to you and grants 6 health and mana. Hammer Throw has a 5 second cooldown.

ht16aw-16.name: Winged Hammers
description: Hammers travel faster.

ht16aw-17.name: Steadfast Path
description: Hammer Throw hits have a chance to deal double damage, but hammers no longer return to you.

ht16aw-18.name: Catapult
description:
Hammer Throw launches additional hammers, but Hammer Throw costs more mana.

Hammers from the same throw cannot hit the same enemy, unless they spiral.

ht16aw-19.name: Avatar of the Spire
description: Hammers are now thrown in a nova, with double the amount of additional hammers unless your hammers spiral. Hammer Throw hits deal additional throwing physical damage.

ht16aw-20.name: Iron Spiral
description: Hammers now travel in a spiral around you, but halves your amount of additional hammers and Hammer Throw costs more mana.
reminderText: Modifiers to projectile speed only affect the tangential velocity of spiralling hammers, not their radial velocity (i.e. they change the speed the hammers go around you, but not the speed at which they travel outwards).

ht16aw-21.name: Hammer Vortex
description: Your spiralling hammers now orbit you, but Hammer Throw costs more mana.

ht16aw-22.name: Ballista
description: Hammer Throw deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and costs less mana.

ht16aw-23.name: Zealot's Conviction
description: Hammer Throw hits have a higher chance to deal double damage.

ht16aw-24.name: Guardian's Zeal
stats: 10% Global Increased Damage Per Zeal Stack
10% Global Increased Crit Chance Per Zeal Stack
description: Using Hammer Throw grants you a stack of {Zeal} for 4 seconds, which increases your damage and critical strike chance by 10% per stack.
reminderText: Buffs granted by {Zeal} are global. You can have a maximum of 3 stacks of {Zeal}.

ht16aw-25.name: Rahyeh's Legacy
stats: +10% Global Ignite Chance Per Zeal Stack
description: Each stack of {Zeal} also grants you added global ignite chance.

javeli-2.name: Go for the Legs
description: Javelin hits have a chance to cause enemies to bleed and have a chance to slow.

javeli-4.name: Keen Outlook
description: Javelin hits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to enemies the further away they are, up to a maximum.

javeli-5.name: Forceful Hurl
description: Javelin gains physical and lightning penetration for each second you have been standing still up to a maximum duration.
reminderText: Partial seconds are counted towards the maximum bonus. For examble standing still for half a second grants Javelin 6% physical and lightning penetration with one point allocated. This is counted when Javelin is thrown, not when you start throwing.

javeli-6.name: Strategic Patience
description: Javelin deals more damage, but has less attack speed (both multiplicative with other modifiers).

javeli-7.name: Holy Spears
description: Javelin hits deal additional lightning damage.

javeli-9.name: Divine Throws
description:
Javelin's base physical damage is converted to lightning. Consequently this damage scales with increases to lightning damage, but not increases to physical damage.

Ignite and bleed chance from all sources is converted to {Electrify} and effects related to bleed or ignite now depend on Electrify instead.

Swaps Javelin's {Physical} tag for a {Lightning} tag.

javeli-10.name: Purifying Lightning
description: Javelin has a chance to {Electrify} enemies on hit. Electrify applied by Javelin has additional Lightning Penetration.

javeli-11.name: Divine Fury
description: When Javelin hits an enemy it now splits into additional piercing lightning spears which aim towards enemies close to the target, but Javelin itself can no longer pierce and it costs more mana.
reminderText: If there are no other enemies nearby the target, only 2 lightning spears will be created. This node does nothing if you have selected the Siege Barrage node.

javeli-12.name: Monster Piercer
description: Javelin hits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) to enemies on high health.
reminderText: Targets above 65% max health are considered to be at high health.

javeli-13.name: Horde Spiker
description: Javelin hits deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) up to a maximum, for each enemy pierced.

javeli-14.name: Beast Ender
description: Improves Javelin's base critical strike chance.

javeli-15.name: Serrated Javelin
description: Javelin hits have a chance to shred enemy armor.

javeli-16.name: Excellent Balance
description: Javelin costs less mana.

javeli-17.name: Perfect Setup
description: Directly using Javelin causes your next melee attack to costs less mana.

javeli-18.name: Sacred Forge
description: Directly using Javelin and hitting an enemy causes your next {Judgement} or {Forge Strike} to deal more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

javeli-19.name: Mighty Delivery
description: Javelin deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and has increased attack speed.

javeli-20.name: Burning Strength
description: Javelin hits have a chance to ignite enemies.

javeli-21.name: Siege Barrage
description: You now throw Javelin into the air causing 3 javelins to rain down at target location dealing damage in an area, but it costs more mana.
reminderText: This node causes Divine Fury to not function.

javeli-22.name: Battle Standard
description:
Now only 1 Javelin rains down at target location, it deals more damage and persists for 4 seconds, but has a cooldown.

It has a {Battle Standard} attached granting you and other allies in its radius increased damage and added endurance threshold based on your attunement.
reminderText:
You are limited to 1 standard.

If Javelin would echo, the echo instead throws down a Javelin similar to the {Siege Barrage} node, rather than another Battle Standard.

javeli-23.name: Banner of Restoration
description: The {Battle Standard} now heals allies around it each second. The amount of health gained is increased by healing effectiveness.

javeli-24.name: Ardent Symbol
description: The {Battle Standard} now lasts longer, but is still limited to one standard.

javeli-25.name: Capture the Flag
description: If an enemy walks over the {Battle Standard} it captures it and carries the flag until it expires.
reminderText: This just means the {Battle Standard} aura moves with the enemy, not that they gain the buffs.

javeli-26.name: Divine Intervention
description: The {Battle Standard} now casts {Smite} at targets nearby every 1.6 seconds.

javeli-27.name: Righteous Descend
description: The {Battle Standard} casts {Smite} more frequently and Smite cast this way has improved base critical strike chance.

javeli-28.name: Surprise Initiative
description:
Javelin is now a combo ability, the first part throws down the {Battle Standard} and the second part causes you to {Dash} to the flag.

Javelin's cooldown is now longer.
reminderText: This effect works even if the {Battle Standard} has been picked up by an enemy.

javeli-29.name: Spiked Bombardment
description: Additional Javelins rain down, but Javelin costs more mana.

javeli-31.name: Holy Trail
description: Javelin now leaves behind a {Holy Trail}, that deals fire and lightning damage to enemies each second, heals you and your allies each second and lasts for 6 seconds, but Javelin now has a cooldown. The amount of health gained is increased by healing effectiveness
reminderText: This has no effect if you have taken the {Siege Barrage} node.

javeli-32.name: Pilgrimage
description: Javelin deals more fire and lightning damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) and you have a chance to ignite and electrify enemies with melee attacks while Javelin is on cooldown.

javeli-33.name: Spear to the Thigh
description: Javelin deals more damage over time (multiplicative with other modifiers).

javeli-35.name: Path of Judgement
stats: +1 Spell Damage per 5% Increased Healing Effectivenes
description: {Holy Trail} gains additional spell damage based on your increased healing effectiveness.

lu25ng-2.name: Dawn Charge
description: You regain a percentage of your missing health when you use Lunge.

lu25ng-3.name: Broadside
description: Lunge deals damage in a wider area along its path.

lu25ng-4.name: Double Strike
description: Lunge gains an additional charge, but it has a longer cooldown.

lu25ng-6.name: Slipstream
description: Other allies caught in the path gain {Haste} for a short duration.

lu25ng-7.name: To Your Aid
description: You can now Lunge to other allies.
reminderText: You cannot Lunge to shields from {Ring of Shields}.

lu25ng-8.name: Healing Rush
description: You now heal allies you Lunge to. The amount of health gained is increased by healing effectiveness.

lu25ng-9.name: Blade Stream
description: Lunge now hits all enemies along its path to your target.
reminderText: Increased Area for Area Skills stats affect the width of the path

lu25ng-11.name: Rough Cuts
description: Lunge hits have a chance to cause enemies to bleed along its path but not its final hit.

lu25ng-12.name: Visceral Path
description: Lunge deals more damage to enemies along its path and with its final hit.

lu25ng-14.name: Torchbearer
description:
Lunge's base physical damage is converted to fire. Consequently this damage scales with increases to fire damage, but not increases to physical damage or other damage types.

Bleed chance from all sources is converted to ignite chance.

Swaps Lunge's {Physical} tag for a {Fire} tag.

This has no effect if you have taken the {Voidbringer} node.

lu25ng-15.name: Juggernaut Dash
description: You have a high chance to block while Lunging.

lu25ng-16.name: Disarming Blow
description: Lunge's final hit has a chance to apply {Frailty} to enemies based on distance traveled up to a maximum.

lu25ng-17.name: Impairing Strike
description: Lunge's final hit now {Immobilizes} enemies for a short duration.

lu25ng-18.name: Deadly Stab
description: Improves Lunge's base critical strike chance when using a spear.

lu25ng-20.name: Initiate's Onslaught
description: Lunge's final hit deals more damage (multiplicative with other modifiers) in a larger area based on distance traveled up to a maximum.

lu25ng-21.name: Cull the Weak
description:
Lunge hits instantly kills enemies that are below a health threshold (a percentage of their maximum health). The threshold is based on distance traveled up to a maximum.

If you have a similar effect from an item or passive node then the highest threshold is used.

lu25ng-22.name: Crusader's Fury
description: After using Lunge you gain additional physical penetration per enemy hit along the path. This buff lasts 4 seconds.
reminderText:
This buff can stack if you use Lunge multiple times within 4 seconds.

If Lunge is converted to Void then this buff grants Void Penetration instead.

If Lunge is converted to Fire then this buff grants Fire Penetration instead.

lu25ng-24.name: Holy Incursion
description: Lunge's final hit has a chance to cast {Smite} at up to 3 nearby targets based on distance traveled up to a maximum.
reminderText: If there are 3 available targets and this effect triggers it will always cast smite at all 3 targets. The cast chance is not rolled individually.

lu25ng-25.name: Unstoppable
description: You are invulnerable while Lunging.

lu25ng-27.name: Reckless Skirmish
description: Killing an enemy with Lunge grants you {Frenzy} for a short duration.

lu25ng-28.name: Voidbringer
description:
Lunge's base physical damage is converted to void. Consequently this damage scales with increases to void damage, but not increases to physical damage or other damage types.

Bleed chance from all sources is converted to chance to inflict {Time Rot}.

Swaps Lunge's {Physical} tag for a {Void} tag.

lu25ng-29.name: Ready or Not
description: Killing an enemy with Lunge resets the cooldowns of {Void Cleave}, {Erasing Strike}, {Forge Strike} and {Judgement}

lu25ng-30.name: Art of the Spear
description: Lunge's final hit now deals damage in an extended rectangle instead of a circle when using a spear.

lu25ng-31.name: Pilum Assault
description:
Lunge's final hit now causes you to use {Javelin} when using a spear.

This consumes Javelin's mana cost.

lu25ng-32.name: Warrior's Renewal
description:
You reduce a portion of Lunge's remaining cooldown when you use a different melee attack and hit at least one enemy. 

This effect can only occur a limited number of times per use of Lunge.

lu25ng-33.name: Ambuscade
description: Lunge deals more melee damage to enemies at high health (multiplicative with other modifiers).
reminderText: Targets above 65% max health are considered to be at high health.

lu25ng-34.name: Lead the Charge
description: You grant other nearby allies {Haste} at the end of the charge for a short duration based on distance traveled, up to a maximum.
reminderText: This does not grant you Haste, but does affect your minions.

lu25ng-35.name: Endless Will
description: {Warrior's Renewal} recovers an additional amount of Lunge's cooldown and also grants you health when it triggers.

ma6hdr-1.name: Platemail
description: Manifested Armor gains increased effect of stats from your body armor.

ma6hdr-2.name: Force of Impact
stats: 1 Melee Physical Damage per 10 Armor On Chest
description: Your Manifest Armor gains melee physical damage equal to a proportion of the armour on your body armour.

ma6hdr-3.name: Bulwark
description: Manifested Armor has more health (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ma6hdr-4.name: Shield-Bearer
description: Manifested Armor gains a shield which scales with the stats of your equipped shield.

ma6hdr-5.name: Self Repair
description: Manifested Armor gains additional health regeneration.

ma6hdr-6.name: Lambent Metal
description: Manifested Armor gains increased effect for health regeneration from all items that affect Manifest Armor.

ma6hdr-7.name: Vengeful Guardian
description: Manifested Armor reflects a percentage of damage to attackers.

ma6hdr-8.name: Thornmail
stats: +1 Damage Reflected Per Point Of Attunement
description: Manifested Armor reflects damage back to attackers for an amount equal to your attunement.

ma6hdr-9.name: Great Helm
description: Manifested Armor gains increased effect of stats from your helmet.

ma6hdr-10.name: Burning Armor
description: Manifested Armor deals additional melee and spell fire damage as well as more fire damage (multiplicative with other modifiers).

ma6hdr-11.name: Blast Forge
